result.execSummary:
The defendant Mona Lisa Kedziora was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bond of $500.00 applied to the court costs.

Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 

If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.

No credit for any time served if probation is revoked.
AODA and follow through with recommended treatment plan.

Defendant Mona Lisa Kedziora in court with attorney Justin D Wolff.  Kristi S Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached and placed on the record.  DE entered a plea of no contest to Cts. 2, 3, and 4.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC.  Pursuant to the agreement Ct. 1 is dismissed and read in.  Court imposed and stayed the following sentence: 30 days county jail on each count, consecutive; payment of court costs; payment of DNA surcharge.  Probation ordered for 2 years: payment of court costs; DNA surcharge; AODA and follow through; counseling as deemed appropriate, and no credit given for any time served.
Mona Lisa Kedziora - Unable to Forward
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Mona Lisa Kedziora in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waived further reading of complaint; requested a preliminary hearing with time limits waived; PTC requested and set.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and only in the dosages prescribed.

arrest

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $2000.00 signature bond and a $500.00 cash bond with conditions of:  comly with booking and no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and only for the amounts as prescribed.  Response by DE.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested, except no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Initial appearance set for 2/04/2014 at 1:00 p.m.
